Style Guide

The bits and bytes that make up this website

Typography

Heading 1

Heading 2

Paragraph

Here’s a link to a website, to a local doc, and to a section heading in the current doc. Here’s a footnote 1. Sometimes you just need to use a little bit of emphasis when talking about code — if you want to learn more, see chapters 2–4 and maybe you’ll find a surprise as well…

This is secondary text that shouldn't stand out as much.

This is some small text.

Links

This is a standalone link

This is a CTA link

Paragraph Callout

I set a goal to read 24 books in 2017. I have already read 3 books in the last 3 weeks

Section Headings

This is a content heading

This is a small heading

Blockquotes

This is a very long line that will still be quoted properly when it wraps. Oh boy let’s keep writing to make sure this is long enough to actually wrap for everyone. Oh, you can put Markdown into a blockquote.

OpenType Modifiers

Small Caps

All Small Caps

12345 (proportional numbers)

1/2

1st 2nd 3rd 4th 96o

Lists

Unordered lists

  • this one
    • another one
  • that one
  • the other one

Ordered lists

  1. First, get these ingredients:
    1. carrots
    2. celery
    3. lentils
  2. Boil some water.
  3. Dump everything in the pot and follow this algorithm:
  4. Do not bump wooden spoon or it will fall.

Buttons

Tables

 First HeaderSecond Header
Y ValueContent from cell 1Content from cell 2
Y ValueContent in the first columnContent in the second column

Code Snippets

Language-agnostic

# Let me re-iterate ...
for i in 1 .. 10 { do-something(i) }

Language-specific

import time

# Quick, count to ten!
for i in range(10):
    # (but not *too* quick)
    time.sleep(0.5)
    print i
